steps.description:
We will shadow one `CCIP` message twice.
1. An off-chain caller asks, `"how much will this cost?"`
2. The same message is later forwarded on-chain and the fee is stamped in.

At every hop the call stack is identical – `Router` → `OnRamp` → `FeeQuoter` – so the `FeeQuoter` contract stays the single source of truth.
A fee quote starts here.  `Router.getFee` only patches a missing `feeToken` (85-88), locates the lane’s `OnRamp` (89-90) and hands the request over (91-92).  No calculations are done at this layer.

`OnRamp.getFee` adds two decisive checks:
- Lines 508–509 abort when the **Risk-Management-Network (RMN)** has cursed the lane.
- Line 510 funnels the request straight into `FeeQuoter.getValidatedFee` – meaning every price comes from `FeeQuoter`.

`FeeQuoter.getValidatedFee` performs the heavy lifting once:
– whitelists destination chain & fee token (562-566),
– validates message structure / gas limits (569-574),
– converts all costs into the caller’s token (574-575).
The off-chain tool now knows the exact amount it must pay.

When the user actually pays, Router forwards the message here.  `forwardFromRouter` lines 221-224 **re-calls** `FeeQuoter.processMessageArgs`, embedding identical pricing (`msgFeeJuels`) and deciding the out-of-order-execution flag.
Immediately afterwards the same function validates each pool’s response and attaches per-token exec gas through `FeeQuoter.processPoolReturnData`.

`processMessageArgs` mirrors the earlier quote: it converts the paid amount to `LINK` (1098-1109) and re-parses `extraArgs` according to chain family while enforcing the same **max-fee guard** (1099-1103).  Any divergence from the quoted logic would revert.
`processPoolReturnData` walks every token transfer:  caps extraData (1168-1174), validates destination token addresses (1178-1182) and encodes the gas stipend that was just billed (1183-1189).

Take-away: `FeeQuoter` is queried twice with the same logic – first off-chain for a `quote`, then on-chain when funds move.  **RMN curse check** guards both paths, and any mismatch between `quote` and `embed` causes a revert.  `FeeQuoter` therefore remains the single authoritative calculator for `CCIP fees`.
